summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, announcing the unsealing of an indictment and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire. It states she is charged with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors and will not appear in SDNY that day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of an unsealed indictment, charged with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors. She was arrested in New Hampshire.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose abuse of minors Ghislaine Maxwell is accused of facilitating.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division
persons.context: The sender of the email, a senior official at the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), providing a heads-up about the indictment and arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as an 'associate' of Epstein and is charged with facilitating his abuse of minors.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire and an indictment against her was unsealed, charging her with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire.
An indictment against Maxwell was unsealed on that date, charging her with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.
The email indicates Maxwell would not be appearing in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on the day of her arrest.
The communication is an internal heads-up from the Chief of the Criminal Division at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY.
